units.title: Apply 4i across developmental timecourse
units.text: To establish a spatial retinal organoid reference map, we applied 4i in covering a timecourse of human retinal organoid development (6, 12, 18, 24 and 39 weeks; 2–4 organoids per timepoint; Supplementary Table 1) as well as an adult primary human retina (Fig. 1a).
units.rationale: Defines the core multiplexed imaging procedure for generating the reference dataset.

units.title: Multiplexed immunohistochemistry on FFPE sections
units.text: For each retinal organoid and the primary adult tissue, we performed multiplexed immunohistochemistry on 3‑μm‑thick formalin‑fixed, paraffin‑embedded (FFPE) sections (1–4 sections per sample; Supplementary Table 1 and Fig. 1b).
units.rationale: Specifies the sample preparation and staining method.

units.title: High‑resolution tiled imaging
units.text: We generated tiled images at ×40 magnification with a high‑numerical‑aperture silicone oil objective to cover length scales from the millimeter to the nanometer scale (pixel size, 0.1625 μm).
units.rationale: Describes the imaging acquisition parameters needed for multiscale analysis.

units.title: Antibody panel construction
units.text: We established a panel of 63 antibodies covering major retinal cell types, subcellular compartments, morphological structures and signaling pathways (Supplementary Table 1).
units.rationale: Provides the reagent set required for comprehensive protein profiling.

units.title: Image alignment and background subtraction
units.text: We aligned images across all cycles, allowing simultaneous display of any protein stain and subtraction of cycle‑specific backgrounds (Supplementary Figs. 1c–f).
units.rationale: Ensures consistent multi‑cycle image registration and noise reduction.

units.title: Laminator algorithm for laminar segmentation
units.text: We developed the Laminator algorithm for laminar window segmentation, vertical orientation and trajectory inference (Fig. 2a).
units.rationale: Introduces the computational tool used to define laminar structures.

units.title: Diffusion‑based trajectory reconstruction
units.text: We performed diffusion analysis for trajectory reconstruction based on pseudotime from laminar windows (Fig. 2a).
units.rationale: Details the method for inferring developmental trajectories from spatial data.

units.title: Single‑cell multi‑omic profiling
units.text: We performed scRNA‑seq and scATAC‑seq from the same cell suspension across a timecourse (6–46 weeks) of human retinal organoid development (Fig. 3a).
units.rationale: Generates complementary transcriptomic and epigenomic data for integration.

units.title: Pooled loss‑of‑function experiment with iCas9
units.text: The iCas9 line was used to generate retinal organoids, which were infected with the pooled lentiviral library at 19 weeks of development, to investigate the role of the TFs in a timepoint in which all cell types are already present. At 3–5 weeks after infection, GFP+ cells were sorted and used.
units.rationale: Describes the genetic perturbation workflow to test transcription‑factor function.

units.title: CROP‑seq assessment of OTX2 LOF
units.text: The CROP‑seq experiment provided sufficient OTX2 guide RNA detection across the different retinal cell types to assess the impact of predicted LOF on each cell type (Fig. 6g).
units.rationale: Outlines the single‑cell CRISPR screening approach for evaluating OTX2 loss‑of‑function.
